result.execSummary:
The defendant Kasey D. Stieber was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Marathon County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
DNA sample.

Defendant to pay restitution in the amount of $10 within one week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kasey D. Stieber

records.addlTxt: Marathon County DNA Proof of Submission

Clerk: Amanda. 
Case called at 8:42 am.
State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Deft appears, pro se.

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  VRCW.
Deft wishes to proceed without an Atty.

State moves to AMEND Ct.1(Forgery-Uttering/Repeater) to Misd. Theft, pursuant to 943.20(1);

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to Ct.1(Misd. Theft/Repeater)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, defendant is competent to represent self, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS: Pay Restitution in the amount of $10, within one week.  Pay CC/DNA surcharge and provide sample. 

Adj: 8:52 am.
Plea hearing on April 27, 2022 at 08:40 am.
on adjournment request for March 17, 2022 Preliminary Hearing
Re: Adjournment Request of March 17, 2022 Preliminary Hearing

Pre-trial conference on January 31, 2022 at 08:50 am.
Preliminary Hearing on March 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: No contact with victim(s): Kwik Trip Stores. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney. No possession of counterfeit bills.

Clerk: Amy. 
Case called: 2:39 p.m. 

State appears by ADA Cody Marschall.  Defendant appears in person, pro se.   

Date and time set for initial appearance. VRCW.  
Reading Waived.Court questions deft re: complaint and rights.
Advised Right of Counsel. 
Prelim Time Limits Waived. 

COURT ORDERS: $500.00 signature bond.

CONDITIONS: 
- No contact with victim(s): Kwik Trip Stores. 
- No possession of counterfeit bills. 

PTC:  1/31/22 at 8:50 a.m. 
PH:  3/17/22 at 3:00 p.m. 

Adj:  2:40 p.m. 

Branch 5 case.
